area_name: An Undercling Thing / Burger King Boulder

content.description: Climb the right arête of the Burger King Boulder to a slab topout. An excellent warmup (it's got jugs!!)
content.protection: Crashpad and spotter and try not to fall from the top.
content.location: On the right arête of the Burger King Boulder, downclimb off the back.

content.description: Standalone traverse on a great feature. Start on the farthest left good edges and make a move onto the continuous crimp rail. Follow it right until you reach the corner, then top out on low-angle rock.
content.location: Walk right from the Burger King Boulder past a few slabs and look for a chalked-up rail leading into a small corridor.

content.description: From the starting seams of An Undercling Thing, stay below the lip and traverse right with wide spans and hand shuffling to reach the starting jug of Penny Pocket. Finish with the long moves of that problem. Very fingery and beta-intensive.
content.protection: This traverse stays low until the topout, use a pad there. Spotting is wise.
content.location: In the corridor between the two boulders, this starts on the blunt arete and traverses right.

content.description: In the corridor between the two boulders. Grab a large edge near head height and make big moves straight up to finish on the tall slab. Don't fall off the top!
content.protection: Crashpad and spotter, no-fall slab up high.
content.location: On the side of the Undercling Thing Boulder, in the corridor between the two boulders. Exit by chimneying back down.

content.description: Start matched on the good sidepull and trend right with powerful moves on crimps and underclings, then top out on the slab. Bigger moves on better holds than the left variation.
content.protection: Pad and a spotter to keep you from landing on the boulder behind.
content.location: On the face of the Burger King Boulder, starting on the sidepull and trending right.

content.description: The center of the well-featured face. Start sitting with right hand on a good sidepull and left hand either matched or on a small edge, and climb roughly straight up on crimps to top out on the slab. There are several different ways to do this problem, using various combinations of the plentiful edges.
content.protection: Pad and spotter to keep you off the boulder behind.
content.location: On the face of the Burger King Boulder, starting on a large sidepull and going straight up.

content.description: Sit start at big holds beneath the arête, make a scrunchy, froggy move to get your feet on the starting holds, then tiptoe up the slab.
content.protection: Pad and a spotter, avoid the boulder behind.
content.location: Climbs the left arête of the Burger King Boulder.

content.description: Obvious solitary line on the bulge of the left boulder. Start sitting at low seams. Make long moves to reach a good hold at the lip, then step up onto the slab and top out.
content.protection: Pad and spotter. Watch out for the boulder behind.
content.location: Left of the corridor between the two boulders, this goes up the bulge onto the slab. Walk off the back.

pathTokens: An Undercling Thing / Burger King Boulder

content.description: The furthest east (right) boulders at the main section of Gloria's. To the right of these two boulders are some tall slab problems that are worth doing.
